segment.source: How to Modify Private Key Permissions to Support Management Server or Streaming Server
segment.target: How to Modify Private Key Permissions to Support Management Server or Streaming Server

segment.source: How to Modify Private Key Permissions to Support Management Server or Streaming Server
segment.target: How to Modify Private Key Permissions to Support Management Server or Streaming Server

segment.source: How to Modify Private Key Permissions to Support Management Server or Streaming Server
segment.target: How to Modify Private Key Permissions to Support Management Server or Streaming Server

segment.source: To support a more secure App-V installation, you can use the following procedures to modify private keys in either Windows Server 2003 or Windows Server 2008.
segment.target: To support a more secure App-V installation, you can use the following procedures to modify private keys in either Windows Server 2003 or Windows Server 2008.

segment.source: To modify the permissions of the private key, you can use the Windows Server 2003 Resource Kit tool .
segment.target: To modify the permissions of the private key, you can use the Windows Server 2003 Resource Kit tool .

segment.source: For Windows Server 2003, the procedure requires that a certificate that meets the prerequisites listed in this document is installed on the computer or computers on which you will install the App-V Management or Streaming Server.
segment.target: For Windows Server 2003, the procedure requires that a certificate that meets the prerequisites listed in this document is installed on the computer or computers on which you will install the App-V Management or Streaming Server.

segment.source: Additional information about using the tool is available at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=151981.
segment.target: Additional information about using the tool is available at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=151981.

segment.source: In Windows Server 2008, the process of changing the ACLs on the private key is much simpler.
segment.target: In Windows Server 2008, the process of changing the ACLs on the private key is much simpler.

segment.source: The certificate’s user interface can be used to manage private key permissions.
segment.target: The certificate’s user interface can be used to manage private key permissions.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The default security context is Network Service; however, a domain account can be used instead.
segment.target: The default security context is Network Service; however, a domain account can be used instead.

segment.source: To manage private keys in Windows Server 2003
segment.target: To manage private keys in Windows Server 2003

segment.source: On the computer that will become the App-V Management or Streaming Server, type the following command in a command prompt to list the current permissions assigned to a specific certificate:
segment.target: On the computer that will become the App-V Management or Streaming Server, type the following command in a command prompt to list the current permissions assigned to a specific certificate:

segment.source: If necessary, modify the permissions of the certificate to provide read access to the security context that will be used for Management or Streaming Service:
segment.target: If necessary, modify the permissions of the certificate to provide read access to the security context that will be used for Management or Streaming Service:

segment.source: Verify that the security context was properly added by listing the permissions on the certificate:
segment.target: Verify that the security context was properly added by listing the permissions on the certificate:

segment.source: To manage private keys in Windows Server 2008
segment.target: To manage private keys in Windows Server 2008

segment.source: Create a Microsoft Management Console (MMC) with the Certificates snap-in that targets the Local Machine certificate store.
segment.target: Create a Microsoft Management Console (MMC) with the Certificates snap-in that targets the Local Machine certificate store.

segment.source: Expand the MMC and select Manage Private Keys.
segment.target: Expand the MMC and select Manage Private Keys.

segment.source: On the Security tab, add the Network Service account with Read access.
segment.target: On the Security tab, add the Network Service account with Read access.
